thread.title: Connie Britton posts emotional goodbye to her fans
thread.title_full: Connie Britton posts emotional goodbye to her fans | Daily Mail Online

author: Dailymail.com Reporter
title: Connie Britton posts emotional goodbye to her fans
text:
It was a sad day for Nashville fans on Thursday.
Rayna Jaymes, played by Connie Britton, was killed off the show in the middle of the fifth season.
She was the queen of country and also the lead character, which is why fans were so shocked when her character died sitting in a police car after a truck hit her.
Goodbye: Rayna Jaymes, played by Connie Britton, was killed off Nashville in the middle of the fifth season
It seems Connie, 49, was just as upset as her fans as she took to Instagram to post a heartfelt tribute on Thursday: 'Thank you Rayna Jaymes. For your magic and your dignity. And thank you to all the creators of Rayna Jaymes, for there were many.
'Callie Khouri, who gave her life. Deacon, Maddie, Daphne, who shaped her as her family. Teddy, Tandy, Lamar too. Juliette, Scarlett, Bucky and the ones who crafted her into a business woman.
'Along with countless other compatriots and combatants. And then of course the crew of â€œNashville" who brought her to life, every crew member in every department who made Rayna live each week.'
Devastating: Her character was sitting in a police car, which was then hit by a truck that eventually killed her
True love: Connie pictured here with Charles Esten, her love interest throughout the show
She posted the message along with a photo of herself in character tearing up on stage.
She posted another photo of her and co-star Charles Esten on Friday with the caption: 'Love this man. Love y'all.'
Esten played Deacon Claybourne in the hit series, who was Rayna Jaymes' love interest throughout the five seasons.
Great friends: She posted another photo of her and co-star Esten on Friday with the caption: 'Love this man. Love y'all'
Glam girls: The show also stars Hayden Panettiere, pictured on the right here
The show, which also stars Hayden Panettiere, Sam Palladio, Jonathan Jackson, Clare Bowen, Lennon Stella, Maisy Stella and Chris Carmack, was axed by ABC after four seasons.
However, it was then picked up by CMT with new showrunners for a fifth season.
It looks as though Connie is moving on quickly however as she already has a new production in the works.
She is joining Ben Mendelsohn in Land Of Steady Habits', which is based on the debut novel from Ted Thompson.
She will also join Edie Falco and Thomas Mann for the Netflix comedy drama.
Having a blast: Esten and Panettiere pictured here at a promotional event for the show
The man: Esten played Deacon Claybourne in the hit series, who was Rayna Jaymes' love interest throughout the five seasons
